For example  Stock X is 1000 USD per share  and I buy 100.1 USD of it  which is 0.1001 share  but actually what I will get is 0.100 share due to rounding on Syfe Trade. Am I correct? If so  then Syfe Trade is not really fee-free  🙁
Based on the fact that the minimum unit on Syfe Trade is 0.001 share  if you buy a stock that's N dollars per share  then at most you will lose N/1000 dollars just because of rounding
They don't round down.. just a most interfaces it's rounded
where do you get this qty?
I checked Syfe APP and the PDF statement they sent me  only 3 digits
you're right  seems that they only hide extra digits in the main interface 🤣
if you sell  click sell all and not type the "rounded" full amount. You can click the question mark to confirm the amount
